arts.ttl: Thiago Motta: “Despite being down to 10 men, we did even better”
arts.sum: Juventus secured their second consecutive victory in the Champions League under Thiago Motta’s leadership, following up their win against PSV with an impressive performance against RB Leipzig. After the match, Motta shared his thoughts on the team’s display. The Juventus coach began by praising the overall performance: “We played a good game right from the first half. We played well even though there were some technical mistakes. In the second half, despite being down to 10 men, we did even better.” Motta was quick to deflect praise onto his players, emphasizing their bravery on the pitch: “The courage wasn’t mine, The post Thiago Motta: “Despite being down to 10 men, we did even better” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Champions League: Leipzig 2-3 Juventus: Player Ratings
arts.sum: Juventus lost Bremer through injury and were reduced to 10 men, but still managed to secure a huge victory against RB Leipzig, winning 3-2 with a brace from Dusan Vlahovic. Juventus Di Gregorio: Did well enough in the early exchanges, but made a rash decision to come out of his box and pick up a red card. 5.5/10 Savona: Still has a way to go, but put in a solid enough shift. A night with plenty of lessons to be learned for the youngster. 5.5/10 Kalulu: He was seemingly everywhere, snuffing out every threat, reading the game with real maturity. The post Champions League: Leipzig 2-3 Juventus: Player Ratings appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Rose on Leipzig's defeat to Juventus: "It's a tough lesson"
arts.sum: Speaking after Leipzig's 3-2 defeat at the hands of Juventus, Marco Rose said he thought his side had been taught a tough lesson.

arts.ttl: Juventus Player Ratings vs Leipzig: Heroic Vlahovic, Marvelous Conceicao
arts.sum: Despite their numerical disadvantage, the Bianconeri still pulled off an astonishing comeback thanks to a brilliant long-range strike from Vlahovic and an astounding solo effort from Francisco Conceicao. So here are our player ratings for Juventus who rallied from behind to register a 3-2 win in Leipzig. arts.ttl: Juve net late winner in comeback win at Leipzig
arts.sum: Ten-man Juventus twice came from a goal down to stun hosts RB Leipzig 3-2 on Wednesday thanks to Francisco Conceicao's 83rd-minute winner, making it two wins from two matches in the Champions League.
